question: Who's son was Joshua (Josh. 1:1)?
In the opening of the book of Joshua, Moses was identified as (Josh. 1:1)
After the death of Moses, what was Joshua instructed to cross over (Josh. 1:2)
The LORD told Joshua he would give him every place (Josh. 1:3)
choice: He marked with a boundary stone
As far as he would see
He needed for the tribes of Israel

question: The LORD told Joshua he would give him the land as he had promised ________ (Josh. 1:3)
The territory Joshua was about to take would extend from the desert as far as the (Josh. 1:4)
No one would be able to stand against Joshua because (Josh. 1:5)
choice: God would be with Joshua as he was with Moses
Israel was now more numerous than the nations in the land
God's angel would give them the victory
The people in the land would fear and scatter

question: God told Joshua to be strong and _________ (Josh. 1:6)
Joshua was going to lead the people to inherit the land God swore to give (Josh. 1:6)
choice: Israel when they came out of Egypt

question: God instructed Joshua that he was to be careful to (Josh. 1:7)
choice: Obey all the law that Moses gave him
Be holy even as God was holy
Love the LORD with all his heart
Trust in the spirit of wisdom God would give him

question: The Book of the Law was not to depart from Joshua's (Josh. 1:8)
Joshua was to do what on the Book of the law day and night (Josh. 1:8)?
As a result of doing everything written in the Book of the law, what results would that have for Joshua (Josh. 1:8)?
choice: He would take the whole land without casualty
He would live long in the land
He would lead Israel all his days
He would be prosperous and successful

question: Because the LORD was with him, Joshua should not be ________ (Josh. 1:9)
Who did Joshua tell to tell the people to get ready to cross the Jordan (Josh. 1:10)?
Joshua told the people to get ready because in _______ day(s) they would cross the Jordan to take possession of the land (Josh. 1:11)
All of the following trans-jordan tribes were required to send their fighting men even though they had already been given land EXCEPT (Josh. 1:12)
All of the following were allowed to stay behind of the trans-jordan tribes EXCEPT (Josh. 1:14)
The trans-jordan tribes were to help their brothers until the LORD gave them ______ (Josh. 1:15)
The tribes from the east of Jordan told Joshua all of the following EXCEPT (Josh. 1:16f)
choice: Whatever he commanded them they would do
Where he sent them they would go
His will would be their command
They would obey him as they had obeyed Moses

question: Whoever did not obey Joshua's command would be (Josh. 1:18)
choice: Forced to draw water and chop wood

question: The trans-jordan tribes told Joshua to be ________ and courageous (Josh. 1:18)
The trans-jordan tribes wished that (Josh. 1:17)
choice: God would be with Joshua as he had been with Moses
God would give Joshua everything he promised to Moses
God would deliver the Canaanites into their hands
God's pillar of fire would destroy their enemies

question: What did Joshua do secretly before they crossed the Jordan (Josh. 2:1)?
choice: Trained his officers with the sword

question: From where did Joshua send out spies (Josh. 2:1)?
How many spies did Joshua send out to explore Jericho (Josh. 2:1)?
Into whose house did the spies enter (Josh. 2:1)?
What was Rahab's trade (Josh. 2:1)
Who sent to Rahab requesting that she bring out the spies (Josh. 2:2f)
What time did the spies enter into Jericho (Josh. 2:2f)?
Rahab told the king of Jericho all of the following EXCEPT (Josh. 2:4f)?
choice: She did not know where they were from
The spies spoke as if they were from Gibeon
She did not know where they went
The king should pursue them quickly

question: When was the city gate of Jericho usually closed, according to Rahab (Josh. 2:5)
Where had Rahab hidden the spies (Josh. 2:6)?
choice: On the roof under stalks of flax
On the roof under some clothes
In the basement behind the steps
In the closet behind her gods

question: The men of Jericho chasing the spies went toward (Josh. 2:7)
choice: The paths to the Salt Sea

question: Rahab told the spies all of the following EXCEPT (Josh. 2:8f)
choice: She knew the LORD had given them this land
She had heard how the LORD dried up the Red Sea
She had heard how Israel had defeated Sihon and Og
She had heard what Israel did to Balaam and Balak

question: Rahab told the spies that the inhabitants of the land were responding with all of the following EXCEPT (Josh. 2:11)
What did Rahab ask that the spies swear to (Josh. 2:12f)?
choice: That they would show kindness to her family
That they would allow her to escape
That they would not destroy her house
That they would marry her after it was all over

question: How did Rahab get the spies out of her house (Josh. 2:15)?
choice: She had them exit at mid-night
She let them down with a rope out her window
She had them tunnel out of her basement
She took them out in a basket

question: Where did Rahab tell the spies to go when they left her house (Josh. 2:16)?
What did the spies request Rahab to do so that her house would not be destroyed (Josh. 2:18)
choice: Tie a yellow ribbon on her door
Tie a scarlet cord on her window
Open her doors when the Israelites took the city

question: When the Israelites took Jericho who would be safe (Josh. 2:18)
choice: All who stood on the wall
Anyone that had a red ribbon on their arm

question: How many days did the spies stay in the hills (Josh. 2:22)?
What did the spies have to cross to return to Joshua (Josh. 2:23)?
The spies told Joshua that the LORD was giving the land to them because (Josh. 2:24)
choice: The people were unable to defend themselves
The people were melting in fear
The people worshipped idols of stone
There were no giants in Jericho

question: Where did Israel leave just before they went to the Jordan (Josh. 3:1)?
Who carried the ark of the covenant across the Jordan (Josh. 3:3)?
choice: Joshua and Caleb and their families
Men that God choose by the Urim and Thumim

question: How far were the Israelites to stay behind the ark as they came to the Jordan (Josh. 3:4)?
The LORD told Joshua that as they crossed the Jordan, Israel would know what (Josh. 3:7)?
choice: God controlled both the water and the dry land
There is no other God but the LORD
God was with Joshua as he had been with Moses

question: Who was to go and stand in the middle of the Jordan (Josh. 3:8)?
The ark was to go before Israel across the Jordan was so that Israel would know that
choice: God would drive out before them the Canaanites
It was not by their own strength that they were taking the land

question: As they were about to cross the Jordan Joshua listed all of the following people groups that God was driving out of the land EXCEPT (Josh. 3:10)
When the priests' feet touched the water's edge at the Jordan what happened (Josh. 3:16)?
choice: The cloud of the LORD blew on the waters
Dry ground arose in the midst of the waters

question: When Israel crossed the Jordan where did the waters pile up not flowing downstream (Josh. 3:16)?
The waters of the Jordan flow down into the Sea of the _______ (Josh. 3:16)
The Sea of the Arabah is also called the _______ Sea (Josh. 3:16)?
Where did those carrying the ark stand as the people of Israel crossed the Jordan (Josh. 3:17)?
choice: On the Jericho side of the bank of the river
On the Shittim side of the bank of the river
On the twelve rocks that were set up as a memorial
In the midst of the river on dry ground

question: What time of the year is the Jordan at flood stage (Josh. 3:15)?
The day before Israel was to cross the Jordan, Joshua told the people to __________ themselves (Josh. 3:5)
Opposite from what town did the Israelites cross the Jordan (Josh. 3:16)?
After the Israelites had crossed the Jordan, what did the LORD tell Joshua to do (Josh. 4:1)?
choice: Choose twelve men one from each tribe
Set up an altar at Gilgal
Raise his hands over the river Jordan
Have the Israelites circle the ark

question: What were the twelve men Joshua chose after crossing the Jordan to do (Josh. 4:3)?
choice: Set up camp around the ark of the covenant
Build an altar upon which to offer a burnt offering
Take up twelve stones from the middle of the Jordan

question: The twelve men carried the stones out of the Jordan as a sign so that in the future what would happen (Josh. 4:6)?
choice: All the tribes were gathered together united when they crossed the Jordan
They could tell their children that the LORD had cut off the waters of the Jordan
God was like a rock who never changes but was faithful to his promises to Abraham, Isaac and Jacob
They could show the nations that God had delivered them from the hands of their enemies

question: After crossing the Jordan, what did Joshua tell them their children would ask in the future (Josh. 4:6)?
choice: "Why is the Jordan chilly and cold?"

question: Who actually set up the twelve stones in the place where they camped after crossing the Jordan (Josh. 4:9)?
choice: The twelve men that were chosen

question: How long does the text say that the twelve stones that were set up after crossing the Jordan remained there (Josh. 4:9)?
choice: Until the Jordan swept them away

question: The men of all of the following tribes went before Israel as they entered into the promise land EXCEPT (Josh. 4:12)
How many men did the trans-jordan tribes supply to help fight with the rest of Israel (Josh. 4:13)?
What did the LORD do for Joshua in the sight of all Israel (Josh. 4:14)?
choice: He made his face to shine
He gave him the rod of Moses

question: Israel revered Joshua (Josh. 4:14)
choice: Just as they had revered Moses
Just as they had revered Aaron
Just as they revered the LORD
Just as they revered their elders

question: When did the waters return to the Jordan (Josh. 4:18)?
choice: When Joshua raised his hands over the river
When the priests came up out of the river with the ark
When the last person came up out of the river
When the twelve men pulled the last stone out of the river

question: When did Joshua cross the Jordan river (Josh. 4:19)
choice: First day of the first month
The fifteenth day of the seventh month
The tenth day of the first month
The last day of the seventh month

question: Where did Joshua set up the twelve stones (Josh. 4:20)
What were the Israelites to tell those that asked what the stones set up after crossing the Jordan meant (Josh. 4:22)?
choice: Israel crossed over on dry ground
That day the LORD fought for Israel
Israel entered the promised land on that day
God was Israel's rock and warrior

question: The LORD dried up the Jordan just as (Josh. 4:23)
choice: He had dried up the Red Sea
He promised Abraham, Isaac and Jacob

question: The LORD dried up the Jordan River so that all the peoples of the earth might know (Josh. 4:24)
choice: That the LORD keeps his promise
That the hand of the LORD is powerful
That God is an awesome God
That the LORD is a holy God

question: The LORD dried up the Jordan River so that Israel might (Josh. 4:24)
The Canaanite kings that heard how the LORD dried up the Jordan lived (Josh. 5:1)
The Amorite kings that heard how the LORD dried up the Jordan lived (Josh. 5:1)
What did the Amorites and Canaanites no longer have after Israel crossed the Jordan (Josh. 5:1)
What was Joshua instructed to use to circumcise Israel (Josh. 5:2)
Where were the Israelites circumcised after crossing the Jordan (Josh. 5:3)?
Gibeath Haaraloth means (Josh. 5:3)
Who died in the desert (Josh. 5:4)?
choice: All those who had eaten the manna in the wilderness
All those who had seen God's fire on Mount Horeb
All those who did not believe
All the military men who left Egypt

question: Who had not be circumcised (Josh. 5:7)?
choice: The children who had not seen God's fire and cloud
The sons who were born on the way in the wilderness
The grandchildren who had defeated Balaam
All the Israelites who left Egypt

question: The LORD said, "Today I have rolled away the reproach of Egypt" at what location which means "roll" (Josh. 5:9)?
What did Israel celebrate on the fourteenth day of the first month when they entered the promised land (Josh. 5:10)?
What did the Israelites eat on the first Passover in the land (Josh. 5:11)?
choice: Unleavened bread and water from the spring at Jericho
Grapes and figs from the land

question: What stopped the day after Passover when Israel entered the land (Josh. 5:12)?
Why did the manna stop (Josh. 5:12)?
choice: Because they complained about it in the hearing of the LORD
Because they ate the produce of Canaan
Because they began farming the land

question: When Joshua was near Jericho before the battle he met a man that had what in his hands (Josh. 5:13)?
Who was it that met Joshua just prior to Joshua's battle at Jericho (Josh. 5:14)?
choice: A man he wrestled with all night
The commander of the army of the LORD
The LORD in a burning bush

question: When Joshua met the commander of the LORD's army what did he tell Joshua to do immediately (Josh. 5:15)?
choice: Cut out stone tablets upon which the law was to be written

question: Why was Joshua told to take off his sandals by the commander of the LORD's army (Josh. 5:15)?
choice: Because the LORD would provide him shoes
Because he would trod on the city of Jericho
Because the place where he stood was holy
Because he would make his enemies go bare foot

question: How many years was Israel in the desert before entering the promised land (Josh. 5:6)?
All the men who left Egypt died in the desert because they had not ________ the LORD (Josh. 5:6)
The LORD said he would deliver all of the following into the hands of Joshua EXCEPT (Josh. 6:2)
For how many days were the Israelite armed men to walk around Jericho once a day (Josh. 6:3)?
What where the priests to carry around Jericho as they marched around Jericho (Josh. 6:4)?
choice: Twelve flags for the tribes of Israel
Twelve stones they had gone the midst of the Jordan

question: On the seventh day how many times were the Israelites to walk around Jericho (Josh. 6:4)?
The priests carrying the trumpets around Jericho were to precede the _______ (Josh. 6:4)
When the trumpets sounded at Jericho what were the people to do (Josh. 6:5)?
What two things were to be done and the wall of Jericho would collapse (Josh. 6:5)?
choice: Bring the ark to the front and stomp their feet
Pray to God and raise the ark
Clap their hands and blow the trumpets

question: How were the people to encircle Jericho during the first days of marching around the city (Josh. 6:10)?
choice: They were not to say a word
They were clap their hands when they finished circling the city
They were to lift their hands to heaven
They were to shout the "sword of the Lord and Joshua"

question: What was the only sound that was to be made as the Israelites circled Jericho (Josh. 6:13)?
choice: The priest's proclamation that the city was theirs

question: After circling the city of Jericho seven times what did Joshua command the people to do (Josh. 6:16)?
When the city of Jericho was taken, Joshua told them that the city was _________ (Josh. 6:15)
choice: Promised to Abraham, Isaac and Jacob
The inheritance of Moses and Aaron

question: Joshua warned them that if they took any of the devoted things they would make the camp _________ (Josh. 6:18)
All the silver, gold, bronze and iron objects from Jericho were to go into the ________ (Josh. 6:19)
choice: The entrance of the Tent of Meeting
Coffers of the tribe of Levi

question: When the walls of Jericho collapsed what did the people do next (Josh. 6:20)?
choice: They took the city gate and palace

question: When Israel took Jericho all of the following were listed as destroyed with the sword all of the following EXCEPT (Josh. 6:21)
Who brought Rahab out of her house after Jericho was taken (Josh. 6:22)?
All of the following were brought out of her house with Rahab after the defeat of Jericho EXCEPT (Josh. 6:23)
After Rahab was released after the defeat of Jericho where were she and her family put (Josh. 6:23)?
choice: In the tents of the spies
Before the entrance of the Tent of Meeting

question: After they captured the city of Jericho what did they do to the city (Josh. 6:24)?
choice: They left it as a ruin
They sounded the trumpets over it

question: Who did Joshua say lived among the Israelites "to this day" (Josh. 6:25)?
choice: Those who had seen Jericho's walls fall
The priests who blew the trumpets as Jericho

question: What curse did Joshua make after the defeat of Jericho (Josh. 6:26)?
choice: Anyone to rebuilt Jericho would be cursed
Anyone taking anything from the city would be cursed
Anyone harming Rahab would be cursed
Anyone taking a brick from the walls of Jericho would be cursed

question: In Joshua's curse on Jericho the youngest child of the rebuilder of Jericho would die when what was done (Josh. 6:26)
choice: When the decision was made to rebuild the city
When the gates were set up

question: In Joshua's curse on Jericho the eldest child of the rebuilder of Jericho would die when what was done (Josh. 6:26)
choice: When the decision was made to rebuild the city
When the gates were set up

question: As they marched around Jericho who went before the priests who had the trumpets (Josh. 6:9)?
After taking Jericho, concerning what did Israel act unfaithfully (Josh. 7:1)
choice: The slaying of the inhabitants of Jericho

question: Who took some of the devoted things from Jericho (Josh. 7:1)?

The town of Ai is near _______ (Josh. 7:1)

choice: Send the best warriors from the tribe of Reuben
Surround the town because there were no walls
Send only a few men there

question: How many men did Joshua send initially to take Ai (Josh. 7:3)?

choice: He sprinkled dust on his head
He put ashes on his forehead

question: After Israel was defeated at Ai where did Joshua fall face down (Josh. 7:6)?
choice: Before the ark of the LORD

question: After the defeat of Ai, Joshua said he wished they had been content with what (Josh. 7:7)
choice: Staying on the other side of the Jordan

question: Joshua called the inhabitants of Ai who defeated them __________ (Josh. 7:7)

Achan was the son of ________ (Josh. 7:18)
Achan confessed that he had taken all of the following EXCEPT (Josh. 7:21)
Where had Achan put the plunder that he had stolen from Jericho (Josh. 7:21)?
choice: In the ground under his tent
In the wall behind his tent

question: How was Achan killed by the Israelites (Josh. 7:25)?

All of the following were burned in the destruction of Achan EXCEPT (Josh. 7:26)?

The LORD told Joshua that he would had delivered into Joshua's hands all of the following EXCEPT (Josh. 8:2)
choice: The storehouses of the King of Ai
The people of the King of Ai
The land of the King of Ai

question: Joshua was told to do to Ai as they had done to Jericho with one exception (Josh. 8:2)
choice: The Israelites got to carry off the plunder
The Israelites did not have to destroy the city itself
The Israelites were not to burn the city
The Israelites were to pursue the soldiers of Ai to the Great Sea

question: What did Joshua do with 30,000 of his men in the engagement at Ai (Josh. 8:3)?
choice: He set them to attack the city of Ai straight on from the desert
He told them to flee when the men of Ai attacked
He told them to set an ambush for the town of Ai
He left them to guard their families at Jericho

question: After Joshua's men had taken the city, what were they to do (Josh. 8:8)?
choice: Break down the walls and gates
Drive all the people out of the town
Send a red cord as a signal to Joshua that they had taken the town

question: The men lying in ambush against the town of Ai lay in wait (Josh. 8:9)

How many of Joshua's troops were set in ambush behind the town of Ai (Josh. 8:12)?
The men in ambush camped to the ________ of Ai (Josh. 8:13)
The battle with the king of Ai took place in a valley overlooking (Josh. 8:14)
When Joshua's men purposely fled from the king of Ai they fled to the (Josh. 8:15)
What city sent troops to participate in the battle against Joshua at Ai (Josh. 8:17)?
What did the LORD instruct Joshua to do to signal the men lying in ambush to take the city (Josh. 8:13)
choice: He shot a fiery arrow into the sky

question: How many men and women were killed in the battle of Ai (Josh. 8:25)?
What did Joshua do to the town of Ai (Josh. 8:28)?
choice: He set up an altar to the LORD from the stones of the town
He tore down its walls and gates
He made it a permanent heap

question: What did Joshua put on Mount Ebal (Josh. 8:30)?
choice: A memorial heap of stones celebrating the victory over Ai

question: What type of tools were not used on the altar that Joshua built on Mount Ebal (Josh. 8:31)?
What did Joshua do on the stones on Mount Ebal (Josh. 8:32)?
choice: Copied the law of Moses on them
Made a memorial for the twelve tribes
Built an altar of carefully crafted stones

question: What happened to the king of Ai (Josh. 8:29)?
choice: He was burned inside the city
He was slain with the sword
He fell from a cliff and was killed as he fled from Israel
He was hung on a tree until evening

question: The elders and judges were divided with half of them standing before Mount Ebal and the others before Mount _______ as Moses had instructed (Josh. 8:33)
What specific words did Joshua read to Israel as they were gathered at Mount Ebal and Mount Gerizim (Josh. 8:34)?
choice: The covenant with Abraham, Isaac and Jacob

question: Joshua read from what book when he was before Mount Ebal (Josh. 8:34)
choice: The Book of the Wars of the LORD

question: All of the following were explicitly listed as hearing the Book of the Law that Joshua read to the people EXCEPT (Josh. 8:35)

All of the following were listed as people groups in the promised land with kings EXCEPT (Josh. 9:1)

choice: They came together to make war
They united and offered a covenant of peace
They cried out to their gods
They locked and barred their city gates

question: The people of what town heard of Joshua's defeat of Ai and Jericho and resorted to a ruse (Josh. 9:3)?

The people of Gibeon were from what people group (Josh. 9:7)?
The Gibeonites said that they came to Joshua because of (Josh. 9:9)
The Gibeonites had heard of all of the following great acts of God EXCEPT (Josh. 9:9f)
choice: How he had provided them with food in the desert
What they had done to Og king of Bashan
What they had done to Sihon king of Heshbon
All that he did in Egypt

question: When the Gibeonites presented their goods to Israel, what did the Israelites not do (Josh. 9:14)?
choice: Seek the counsel of the elders

question: Who ratified the treaty of peace Joshua made with the Gibeonites (Josh. 9:15)

All of the following were listed as cities of the Gibeonites EXCEPT (Josh. 9:17)

choice: They would be slaves in their fields
They would be servants of the LORD at the tabernacle
They would be shepherds and herdsmen
They would be woodcutters and water carriers

question: Who are woodcutters and water carriers for Israel "to this day" (Josh. 9:27)?
What command of Moses had the Gibeonites heard of (Josh. 9:24)?
choice: To wipe out the inhabitants of the land
To make an offer of peace
To divide all the promised land among the tribes of Israel
To burn all the cities to the ground

question: After Joshua had taken Ai, who was king of Jerusalem (Josh. 10:1)
Who heard what Joshua had done to Ai and Jericho and their kings (Josh. 10:1)?

choice: They had fortified their city with thick walls
Their men were all good fighters
Their were giants in their midst
They offered their children in sacrifice

question: Who was king of Hebron during the time of Joshua (Josh. 10:3)?

choice: The walls fell on top of them

question: At the battle against the Amorite kings who attacked Gibeon, Joshua prayed that the ________ stand still over Gibeon (Josh. 10:12)

choice: On the rocks Joshua set up at Gibeon
On the scrolls of the kings of Judah

question: What was unique about the day the sun stood still (Josh. 10:14)?
choice: God showed his might and power
Even the Gibeonites worshipped the Lord
God listened to the voice of a man

question: At the battle over Gibeon who fought for Israel (Josh. 10:15)?
Where had the five kings hidden after the battle at Gibeon (Josh. 10:16)
choice: In the swamps of the plains

question: While the Amorite kings were sealed in a cave Joshua told his men to continue the pursuit so that the enemies would not (Josh. 10:19)
When Joshua pulled the five Amorite kings from the cave of Makkedah what did he have his commanders do before they killed them (Josh. 10:24)?
choice: Put their heads in a stocks
Take off their sandals and spit on them
Put their feet on their necks

question: What fate did the five Amorite kings face after their deaths (Josh. 10:26)?
choice: Their bodies were sent back to their cities
Their bodies were hung on a trees until evening
They were covered with a pile of rocks
They were cast into a ditch like dogs

question: Joshua did to the king of Makkedah as he had done to the king of _________ (Josh. 10:28)
From Makkedah what was the next city to be taken by Joshua (Josh. 10:29)?
From Libnah what was the next city to be taken by Joshua (Josh. 10:31)?

Which city was taken and its villages (Josh. 10:36)?

Jabin's troops had what military advantage over Israel (Josh. 11:4)?
Where did the northern kings, the forces of Jabin of Hazor, camp (Josh. 11:5)?
Jabin was king of what famous northern city (Josh. 11:1)
Joshua pursued the forces of Jabin until (Josh. 11:8)
choice: He had driven them out of the north
They had captured the five kings
They had captured all their wells

question: What did Joshua do to Jabin's horses and chariots (Josh. 11:9)?
choice: Hamstrung the horses and burned the chariots
Set the horses free and ground the chariots to dust

How could they reject the laws of Moses the servant of the LORD?

choice: The sin of complaining because their was no water

A sign that there is one God and the LORD is his name

question: In Joshua's farewell speech he said he was going the way of _________ (Josh. 23:14)

That they should worship the Lord

question: Joshua, in his farewell speech, warned the leaders that if they did what God would bring evil upon them (Josh. 23:16)?
choice: Turned their backs on the LORD
Forgot the commandments of the LORD
Said that they had conquered the land

question: Joshua, in his farewell speech, warned the leaders that God's anger would burn against them if they did what (Josh. 23:16)?

question: Joshua, in his farewell speech, warned the leaders that God's anger would express itself in _________ (Josh. 23:16)
choice: He would not listen to their prayers
The nations driving them out of the land
Droughts and plagues like they had seen in Egypt
Israel's perishing from the good land

Joshua admonished the people to fear the LORD and serve him with all ________ (Josh. 24:14)
Joshua admonished the people to throw what away (Josh. 24:14)?
choice: The gods their forefathers worshiped beyond the River
The gods of the people they had conquered
The plunder of the inhabitants of the land

question: Joshua said "But as for me and my household, we will _______ the LORD (Josh. 24:15)
The people said they chose to follow the LORD because he had done all of the following for them EXCEPT (Josh. 24:16)
choice: Protected them in their entire journey among the nations
Brought their forefathers out of Egypt from the land of slavery
Performed great signs before their eyes

question: Joshua told the people they were not able to serve the LORD because of what two qualities in God (Josh. 24:19)
choice: He was a righteous and awesome God
He was a holy and jealous God
He was a pure and holy God

question: When the people acknowledged that they were witnesses against themselves, Joshua told them to throw what away (Josh. 24:23)?
choice: Their clothes that they had worn in the desert

question: Where did Joshua make a covenant for the people drawing up laws and decrees (Josh. 24:25)?
Where did Joshua record the things concerning the covenant that he made with the people at Shechem (Josh. 24:26)?
choice: On the altar he built before the LORD
In the Book of the Law
On a plastered rock he set up
On the doorframes of their houses

question: What did Joshua set up under an oak near the holy place of the LORD at Shechem as a witness against the Israelites (Josh. 24:27)?
How old was Joshua when he died (Josh. 24:29)?
Joshua was buried in his inheritance at ________ (Josh. 24:30)
Joshua was buried in the hill country of what tribe (Josh. 24:30)?
Whose bones did the Israelites bury at Shechem (Josh. 24:32)?
Joseph was buried on the plot of land that Jacob bought from _________ (Josh. 24:32)
choice: Caleb the son of the Negev

question: Who was the son of Aaron who died and was buried in Gibeah (Josh. 24:33)?
Who was Eleazar's son who had been allotted territory in Ephraim (Josh. 24:33)?
